required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MEDI-551 as Maintenance Therapy After Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplant in Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study of MEDI-551 as Maintenance Therapy After Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplant in Patients With Newly Diagnosed Poor-risk or Relapsed Multiple Myeloma

lead_sponsor.agency: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

clinical_study.source: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

brief_summary.textblock: Determine the progression free survival of high-risk or relapsed Multiple Myeloma (MM) patients undergoing non-myeloablative bone marrow allogeneic transplantation (NM-AlloSCT) followed by maintenance therapy with MEDI-551.

clinical_study.why_stopped: MEDI-551 removed from oncology by pharmaceutical company due to change in research target.

primary_outcome.description: The progression free survival (PFS) of high-risk or relapsed multiple myeloma (MM) patients undergoing non-myeloablative bone marrow allogeneic transplantation (NM-AlloSCT) followed by maintenance therapy with MEDI-551.

arm_group.description: Medi-551 maintenance therapy will be initiated on Day 60, Day 90, or Day 120 of NM-AlloSCT based on the eligibility criteria for the initiation of maintenance therapy as described in Section 3.1. MEDI-551 will be administered on 28-day cycles at a dose of 4mg/kg, as an IV infusion over 60 ±15 minutes. Infusion sets must contain a 0.2 micron in-line filter. MEDI-551 will be administered on days 1, 8, 15, and 22 of cycle 1, then 4mg/kg IV on day1 of cycles 2 through 12. Treatment may be stopped earlier if there is unacceptable toxicity, development of Grade 3 or 4 graft-versus-host disease (GVHD), documentation of disease progression, or patient withdrawal for other reasons.

intervention.description: Cycle 1 - Days 1, 8, 15, and 22: 4mg/kg IV Cycles 2-12 - Day 1: 4mg/kg IV

overall_official.affiliation: The Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

facility.name: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.population: One participant signed consent and was enrolled on this study. However, the study was closed before the participant received study drug.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival
outcome.description: The progression free survival (PFS) of high-risk or relapsed multiple myeloma (MM) patients undergoing non-myeloablative bone marrow allogeneic transplantation (NM-AlloSCT) followed by maintenance therapy with MEDI-551.
outcome.population: This study was terminated - the patient did not receive study drug.

measure.title: Progression Free Survival
measure.description: The progression free survival (PFS) of high-risk or relapsed multiple myeloma (MM) patients undergoing non-myeloablative bone marrow allogeneic transplantation (NM-AlloSCT) followed by maintenance therapy with MEDI-551.
measure.population: This study was terminated - the patient did not receive study drug.

reported_events.time_frame: For the duration of the study, about 7 months.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
